data.meta_description: Religion: In West Ham, the 'Christian' community represents the largest religious group, making up 46.38% of the population, 'Muslim' population follows at 24.91% and 'No religion' is 3rd with 16.38% Ethnic groups: The predominant ethnic group in West Ham is 'White', constituting 36.44% of the total population. The 'Asian, Asian British or Asian Welsh' ethnic group is second largest, making up 27.53%, while 'Black, Black British, Black Welsh, Caribbean or African' accounts for 24.05%. Economic activity: 62.77% of West Ham's population is economically active. The primary job roles are 'Elementary' and 'Professional occupations' Health: Majority of the population are in very good health. Most common age groups are those aged 35 to 49 years and aged 50 to 64 years. Additionally, 35.84% of its inhabitants is married and 50.51% are single. Living Arrangements and Property Types: Majority of the households are Single family households (52.8%). Most of the properties in West Ham are flats or terraced, with the majority of the ownership either being social rented or private rented Crime rate: As of 2022, West Ham crime rate (crime per 1000 residents) stands at 100.13. Most common crime types are 'Violence and sexual offences', 'Anti-social behaviour' and 'Vehicle crime'.
data.text:
According to the 2021 census, West Ham had a total of 15,700 usual residents residing in 5,335 households, indicating an average household size of 2.9. The borough covers an area of 35.2 square kilometers resulting in a population density of 11,742.7 individuals per square kilometer. The average age of its residents was 35.2 years.

Religion: In West Ham, the ‘Christian’ community represents the largest religious group, making up 46.38% of the population, ‘Muslim’ population follows at 24.91% and ‘No religion’ is 3rd with 16.38%

Ethnic groups: The predominant ethnic group in West Ham is ‘White’, constituting 36.44% of the total population. The ‘Asian, Asian British or Asian Welsh’ ethnic group is second largest, making up 27.53%, while ‘Black, Black British, Black Welsh, Caribbean or African’ accounts for 24.05%.

Economic activity: 62.77% of West Ham’s population is economically active. The primary job roles are ‘Elementary’ and ‘Professional occupations’

Health: Majority of the population are in very good health. Most common age groups are those aged 35 to 49 years and aged 50 to 64 years. Additionally, 35.84% of its inhabitants is married and 50.51% are single.

Living Arrangements and Property Types: Majority of the households are Single family households (52.8%). Most of the properties in West Ham are flats or terraced, with the majority of the ownership either being social rented or private rented

Crime rate: As of 2022, West Ham crime rate (crime per 1000 residents) stands at 100.13. Most common crime types are ‘Violence and sexual offences’, ‘Anti-social behaviour’ and ‘Vehicle crime’.

West Ham in comparision with 24 Newham wards

When we analyze the percentage distribution of population and households, we see that West Ham surpasses most of Newham wards in the following metrics.
